title: Corrie's Sue Nicholls written out of scenes after nasty injury and secret op
text:
Sue had an accident at home after falling off her bed in the night (Picture: Getty; Rex; ITV)

Sue Nicholls has revealed that Audrey Roberts has been missing from Coronation Street because an accident at home caused her to be suddenly written out of the show in secret.

Earlier this year, shortly after winning her Outstanding Achievement Award at this year’s British Soap Awards, the 75-year-old actress suffered an accident at home.

As a result, she was rushed to hospital and had to have an operation to get herself back to fighting fit.

Speaking to The Mirror, she said: ‘I was creeping around in the dark after taking my face off at about 11 o’clock and sat on the side of the bed. But I missed the bed and fell over.

‘I had to have an operation, be written out of some scenes and take time off – which I hate doing as I don’t like letting people down. But everyone was so lovely.’

Despite the incident, Sue is determined to carry on and has no plans to slow down anytime soon on Corrie – after playing the character for the past 40 years.

Audrey has disappeared as in real life Sue had an operation after a nasty fall (Picture: Rex)

‘I have fun here, I’d never want to just sit at home,’ she said. ‘If they ever got rid of me I might try doing other things – I’d love to go back to singing and get my voice trained again – just to do something. I wouldn’t retire.’

‘If they’ll have me, I’d love to be here in 10 years’ time because I like playing her,’ she continued. ‘There’s lots to achieve yet, so if I get the sack I’ll lock myself in Audrey’s salon and refuse to leave.’

The Corrie legend was awarded for her work on the show back in June at the British Soap Awards with a special message from Sir Ian McKellen.

Sue was surprised with the honour, and in her speech joked: ‘I was paid for all those scenes, you know?’

‘I love it, I’m better in the Weatherfield world than I am in the real world to be honest. But I want to thank everybody, and all the studio people that put the show on.’
